results.translated_text: C’est une vérité universellement reconnue qu’un célibataire fortuné doit être à la recherche d’une femme. Si peu que l’on connaisse les sentiments ou les opinions d’un tel homme à son arrivée dans un nouveau quartier, cette vérité est si ancrée dans l’esprit des familles voisines qu’il est considéré comme la propriété légitime de l’une ou l’autre de leurs filles.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though 'à la recherche d'une femme' is slightly less elegant than the original's implied social obligation. The prose flows naturally in French, but 'quartier' (neighborhood/district) is a minor word choice that could be 'région' or 'localité' for better stylistic match with the original's formal register.

results.translated_text: Le studio baignait dans l’odeur riche et envoûtante des roses, et quand la brise légère de l’été frôlait les arbres du jardin, une bouffée plus lourde du parfum de lilas, ou plus subtile encore de l’aubépine aux fleurs roses, pénétrait par la porte entrouverte. Depuis le coin du divan garni de housses persanes à la manière des selles, où il était allongé, fumant comme à son habitude une infinité de cigarettes, lord Henry Wotton pouvait à peine apercevoir l’éclat des fleurs dorées et sucrées du cytise.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Wilde's sensory aestheticism well, with strong rendering of the floral imagery and atmospheric details. Minor issues include 'baignait dans' being slightly more active than the original 'was filled with,' and 'à la manière des selles' adding interpretive explanation rather than direct translation, but these enhance rather than diminish the prose.

results.translated_text:
— Vous avez été en Afghanistan, je le vois bien.
— Comment diable avez-vous deviné cela ? demandai-je, stupéfait.
— Peu importe, dit-il en riant sous cape. La question maintenant porte sur l’hémoglobine. Ne voyez-vous pas toute l’importance de cette découverte que j’ai faite ?
— C’est intéressant, sans doute, sur le plan chimique, répondis-je, mais en pratique…
— Mais enfin, mon cher, c’est la découverte médico-légale la plus pratique depuis des années ! Ne comprenez-vous pas que cela nous offre un test infaillible pour les traces de sang ?

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves meaning and dialogue flow with excellent French phrasing. Minor stylistic consideration: 'riant sous cape' is slightly more colloquial than Holmes's typical demeanor, and 'mon cher' adds informality not present in the original, though these choices remain defensible for character voice.

results.translated_text: Je suis allé dans les bois parce que je voulais vivre délibérément, affronter seulement les faits essentiels de la vie et voir si je ne pouvais pas apprendre ce qu’elle avait à m’enseigner. Je ne voulais pas, en arrivant à mourir, découvrir que je n’avais pas vécu. Je ne voulais pas vivre ce qui n’était pas la vie, car la vie est si précieuse ; et je ne voulais pas non plus pratiquer la résignation, sauf si c’était absolument nécessaire. Je voulais vivre intensément et savourer jusqu’à la moelle toute la substance de la vie.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency with minor structural adjustments. The rendering captures the meditative tone and poetic intensity well, though 'savourer jusqu'à la moelle' slightly softens the visceral force of 'suck out all the marrow.'

results.translated_text: Appelons-moi Ismaël. Il y a quelques années — peu importe exactement combien — n'ayant presque plus un sou en poche et rien de particulier qui m'attirât à terre, je pensai qu'il serait bon de prendre la mer un peu et de voir la partie aquatique du monde. C’est une manière que j’ai de chasser la mélancolie et de stimuler la circulation. Dès que je sens mon humeur s’assombrir, dès que novembre, gris et pluvieux, s’installe dans mon âme, je juge qu’il est grand temps de prendre la mer sans plus attendre.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Melville's meaning with only minor shifts (e.g., 'n'ayant presque plus un sou' slightly weakens 'little or no money'), and reads naturally in French. However, the archaic literary tone is somewhat softened—phrases like 'Appelons-moi' and 'il serait bon de prendre' lack the commanding intimacy and philosophical weight of the original's opening.

results.translated_text: Es ist eine allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit, dass ein lediger Mann, der im Besitz eines ansehnlichen Vermögens ist, unbedingt eine Frau suchen muss. Wie wenig auch die Gefühle oder Ansichten eines solchen Mannes bei seinem ersten Erscheinen in einer Nachbarschaft bekannt sein mögen, diese Wahrheit ist so tief in den Köpfen der umliegenden Familien verankert, dass er als rechtmäßiges Eigentum der einen oder anderen ihrer Töchter betrachtet wird.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures Austen's meaning and ironic tone, with faithful rendering of key phrases like 'allgemein anerkannte Wahrheit' and 'rechtmäßiges Eigentum.' Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ('unbedingt eine Frau suchen muss' is slightly less elegant than the original's ironic understatement), but the overall style and satirical voice are well-preserved.

results.translated_text: Das Atelier war erfüllt vom reichen Duft der Rosen, und wenn der leichte Sommerwind durch die Gärten strich und zwischen den Bäumen spielte, drang durch die offene Tür der schwere Duft des Fliederbuschs herein oder das zartere Parfüm des pinkblühenden Weißdorns. Aus der Ecke des mit persischen Satteltaschen gepolsterten Divans, auf dem er, wie es seine Gewohnheit war, unzählige Zigaretten rauchend lag, konnte Lord Henry Wotton gerade noch den honigsüßen, honigfarbenen Schimmer der Goldregenblüten erhaschen.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves Wilde's sensory-rich aesthetic language effectively, with accurate rendering of botanical imagery and atmospheric details. Minor fluency issues arise from the slightly awkward phrase "durch die Gärten strich und zwischen den Bäumen spielte" (more literal than the original's flowing construction) and the compound "honigsüßen, honigfarbenen" which, while accurate, feels slightly more mechanical than Wilde's poetic rhythm.

results.translated_text:
„Sie waren in Afghanistan, nehme ich an.“
„Wie zum Teufel konnten Sie das wissen?“, fragte ich erstaunt.
„Ach, das ist unwichtig“, sagte er und kicherte vor sich hin. „Die Frage ist jetzt die nach dem Hämoglobin. Sie erkennen zweifellos die Bedeutung dieser meiner Entdeckung?“
„Chemisch ist sie zweifellos interessant“, antwortete ich, „aber praktisch –“
„Mein Gott, Mann, das ist die praktischste medizinisch-rechtliche Entdeckung in Jahren! Sehen Sie nicht, dass sie uns einen unfehlbaren Test für Blutspuren liefert?“

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and captures Holmes's deductive brilliance and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include 'kicherte vor sich hin' (chuckled to himself) being slightly less natural than alternatives, and 'Mein Gott, Mann' feeling marginally less idiomatic than the original's emphatic tone, though the overall Victorian dialogue style is well maintained.

results.translated_text: Ich ging in den Wald, weil ich bewusst leben wollte – nur den wesentlichen Dingen des Lebens begegnen und lernen, was es mir zu lehren hatte. Und wenn ich sterben müsste, wollte ich nicht entdecken, dass ich nie wirklich gelebt hatte. Ich wollte nicht ein Leben führen, das kein Leben war, denn das Leben ist zu kostbar. Und ich wollte mich nicht mit Resignation abfinden, es sei denn, es war unbedingt nötig. Ich wollte tief leben und jeden Tropfen des Lebens in mich aufnehmen.

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and most key meanings accurately, with natural German phrasing. However, 'jeden Tropfen des Lebens in mich aufnehmen' (every drop of life) loses the visceral intensity of 'suck out all the marrow,' and some of the original's rhythmic repetition is diminished, slightly affecting the meditative style.

results.translated_text: Nennt mich Ismael. Vor einigen Jahren – genau wie viele, ist gleichgültig – mit kaum einem Pfennig in der Tasche und nichts Besonderem, das mich an Land fesselte, dachte ich, ich würde ein wenig zur See fahren und die wasserumtoste Welt erkunden. Das ist meine Art, die Melancholie zu vertreiben und den Blutkreislauf zu ordnen. Immer, wenn ich mich um den Mund herum grimmig finde, wenn es in meiner Seele ein trüber, nebliger November ist, halte ich es für höchste Zeit, so schnell wie möglich auf See zu gehen.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Melville's meaning and archaic tone, with strong choices like 'wasserumtoste Welt' capturing the poetic quality. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward constructions ('um den Mund herum grimmig finde'), and 'Pfennig' may feel too specific historically, but overall the translation successfully conveys the philosophical melancholy and narrative voice of the original.

results.translated_text: Es una verdad universalmente reconocida que un hombre soltero, poseedor de una gran fortuna, debe estar necesariamente al cuidado de una esposa. Por muy poco que se conozcan los sentimientos o las opiniones de un hombre así al llegar a un nuevo barrio, esta verdad está tan arraigada en la mente de las familias vecinas que se le considera como el legítimo botín de alguna o de otra de sus hijas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's ironic meaning and maintains the formal, period-appropriate tone exceptionally well. Minor accuracy issue: 'al cuidado de' (in the care of) slightly misses the original's 'in want of' (desiring/seeking), though 'botín' (booty/prize) brilliantly captures the satirical edge of 'property.'

results.translated_text: El estudio estaba impregnado del intenso aroma de las rosas, y cuando la ligera brisa veraniega se mecía entre los árboles del jardín, a través de la puerta abierta llegaba el pesado perfume del lila o el más sutil aroma del duraznillo de flores rosadas. Desde el rincón del diván de bolsas de montar persas sobre el que yacía, fumando, como era su costumbre, innumerables cigarrillos, lord Henry Wotton apenas podía distinguir el brillo de los dulces y dorados capullos de un laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose with strong vocabulary choices like 'impregnado' and 'sutil.' Minor issues include 'duraznillo' (hawthorn) being less precise than the original 'pink-flowering thorn,' and 'capullos' (buds) slightly altering the visual imagery of 'blossoms,' though the overall effect remains faithful to the ornamental, decadent style.

results.translated_text:
—¿Ha estado en Afganistán, supongo? —preguntó.
—¿Cómo demonios lo supo? —exclamé, sorprendido.
—No importa —dijo, riendo para sus adentros—. Ahora la cuestión es sobre la hemoglobina. Sin duda ve la importancia de este descubrimiento mío, ¿verdad?
—Químicamente es interesante, sin duda —respondí—, pero en la práctica...
—¡Hombre, es el descubrimiento médico-legal más práctico en años! ¿No ve que nos proporciona una prueba infalible para manchas de sangre?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue structure of the original, with excellent handling of Holmes's deductive manner and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include slightly formal phrasing in places ("supongo" as a tag question is less natural than "me parece"), and the exclamation "¡Hombre!" slightly shifts the tone from the original's emphatic "Why, man" construction.

results.translated_text: Fui al bosque porque deseaba vivir deliberadamente, enfrentar solo los hechos esenciales de la vida y aprender qué tenía que enseñarme, para que, al llegar el momento de morir, no descubriera que no había vivido. No quería vivir lo que no fuera vida, pues la vida es tan preciosa; ni tampoco practicar la resignación, a menos que fuera absolutamente necesario. Quería vivir con intensidad y extraer hasta la médula todo el jugo de la existencia.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with strong fluency in Spanish. Minor choices like 'extraer hasta la médula todo el jugo' for 'suck out all the marrow' are slightly more elaborate than the original's directness, but effectively convey the intensity and existential urgency of the source text.

results.translated_text: Llámame Ismael. Hace algunos años —no importa exactamente cuántos—, con poco o ningún dinero en el bolsillo y sin nada en particular que me interesara en tierra, pensé que navegaría un poco y vería la parte acuática del mundo. Es mi manera de ahuyentar la melancolía y equilibrar la circulación. Cada vez que me siento sombrío de labio, cada vez que es un noviembre húmedo y gris en mi alma, considero que es hora de embarcarme lo antes posible.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, though 'sombrío de labio' (grim about the lip) is slightly awkward compared to the original's 'grim about the mouth,' and some archaic formality is softened. The overall structure and metaphorical content are well-preserved.

results.translated_text: È una verità universalmente riconosciuta che un uomo single, in possesso di una buona fortuna, debba essere alla ricerca di una moglie. Nonostante le opinioni o i sentimenti di un simile uomo possano essere poco noti al suo primo ingresso in una nuova zona, questa verità è così radicata nelle menti delle famiglie circostanti che egli viene considerato come una preda naturale per una o l'altra delle loro figlie.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning but has notable issues: 'single' is awkwardly rendered as 'single' (English loanword) rather than 'scapolo,' and 'preda naturale' (natural prey) loses the ironic property metaphor of 'rightful property.' The opening sentence's famous ironic tone is somewhat diminished, and the phrasing feels occasionally stilted for Italian prose.

results.translated_text: Lo studio era permeato dal ricco profumo delle rose, e quando la lieve brezza estiva sfiorava tra gli alberi del giardino, attraverso la porta aperta giungeva l’appesantito odore del lilà o il più delicato profumo della rosa canina dai fiori rosa. Dall’angolo del divano, rivestito di sacche persiane a sella su cui era disteso, fumando come era sua abitudine innumerevoli sigarette, lord Henry Wotton riusciva appena a scorgere il bagliore dei fiori dorati e dal miele del laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning and aesthetic sensibility, but 'rosa canina' (wild rose) misidentifies the 'pink-flowering thorn,' and the sentence structure becomes awkward in places, particularly the long clause about the divan. The sensory richness is largely preserved, though some poetic flow is lost.

results.translated_text: «È stato in Afghanistan, lo percepisco.» «Come diavolo hai fatto a saperlo?» chiesi, stupito. «Non importa» disse lui, ridacchiando tra sé. «Ora la domanda è sull'emoglobina. Non dubito che tu veda l'importanza di questa mia scoperta?» «È interessante, senza dubbio, dal punto di vista chimico» risposi, «ma praticamente…» «Ma uomo, è la scoperta medico-legale più pratica degli ultimi anni! Non vedi che ci fornisce un test infallibile per le macchie di sangue?»

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures the deductive dialogue between Holmes and Watson, though "Ma uomo" is slightly awkward phrasing and some formality shifts occur (tu/lei inconsistency). The Victorian tone is mostly preserved but could feel more natural in places.

results.translated_text: Sono andato nei boschi perché volevo vivere consapevolmente, affrontare solo le realtà essenziali della vita e vedere se non avessi potuto imparare ciò che aveva da insegnarmi. Non volevo scoprire, al momento di morire, di non aver vissuto. Non desideravo vivere una vita che non fosse vita, poiché la vita è così preziosa; né volevo praticare la rassegnazione, se non fosse stato assolutamente necessario. Volevo vivere in profondità, assaporare fino all'ultima goccia il midollo della vita.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with excellent rendering of key concepts like 'live deliberately' (vivere consapevolmente) and 'suck out all the marrow' (assaporare fino all'ultima goccia il midollo). Minor deviations include slight restructuring of the opening clause and 'preziosa' for 'dear' which shifts slightly toward preciousness rather than costliness, but overall maintains the contemplative, declarative tone and rhetorical power of the orig

results.translated_text: Chiamatemi Ismaele. Qualche anno fa — non importa esattamente quanti — avendo nel portafogli poco o nulla e nulla di particolare che mi interessasse a terra, pensai di mettermi in mare per un po’ e vedere la parte acquatica del mondo. È un mio modo di scacciare la malinconia e dare slancio al sangue. Ogni volta che mi sento diventare cupo di labbra, ogni volta che novembre è umido e grigio nell’anima, ritengo che sia giunto il momento di imbarcarmi il prima possibile.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with only minor deviations (e.g., 'portafogli' is more modern than period-appropriate, 'dare slancio al sangue' slightly shifts Melville's 'regulating the circulation'). While generally fluent, some phrasings feel slightly stiff compared to the original's natural cadence, and the archaic literary tone could be more consistently maintained throughout.

results.translated_text: É uma verdade universalmente reconhecida que um homem solteiro, possuidor de uma boa fortuna, deve necessariamente estar à procura de uma esposa. Por mais desconhecidos que sejam os sentimentos ou opiniões de tal homem ao ingressar numa nova vizinhança, esta verdade está tão firmemente enraizada nas mentes das famílias circundantes que ele é considerado como propriedade legítima de uma ou outra de suas filhas.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with excellent vocabulary choices like 'universalmente reconhecida' and 'enraizada.' Minor fluency issues include slightly awkward phrasing in 'Por mais desconhecidos que sejam' which, while grammatically correct, reads less smoothly than the original's cadence.

results.translated_text: O estúdio estava impregnado pelo aroma intenso de rosas, e quando a brisa leve do verão agitava as árvores do jardim, através da porta aberta chegava o perfume pesado do lilás ou o mais delicado aroma do espinheiro-de-flores-rosadas. Do canto do divã, forrado com couro de sela persa sobre o qual estava deitado, fumando, como era seu costume, incontáveis cigarros, Lord Henry Wotton conseguia avistar, entre os arbustos, o brilho das flores melosas e douradas do laburno.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and meaning accurately, though 'forrado com couro de sela persa' (lined with Persian saddle leather) slightly misinterprets the original 'divan of Persian saddle-bags.' The addition of 'entre os arbustos' (among the bushes) is not in the source text. While generally fluent, the prose lacks some of Wilde's characteristic aesthetic elegance and the poetic flow of the original's sensory layering.

results.translated_text:
"— Você esteve no Afeganistão, percebo.”
— "Como diabos você soube disso?" perguntei, espantado.
— "Não importa", disse ele, rindo consigo mesmo. "A questão agora é sobre a hemoglobina. Sem dúvida, você percebe a importância desta minha descoberta?"
— "É interessante do ponto de vista químico, sem dúvida", respondi, "mas na prática..."
— "Ora, homem, é a descoberta médico-legal mais prática dos últimos anos! Não vê que isso nos dá um teste infalível para manchas de sangue?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with excellent character voice and period-appropriate language. Minor points: 'rindo consigo mesmo' is slightly less idiomatic than 'rindo para si' would be, and the exclamation 'Ora' captures Holmes's tone well though 'Pois bem' might feel marginally more natural in context.

Queria viver intensamente e extrair até a medula da vida.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the philosophical meaning and structure well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (deliberadamente) and 'essential facts' (fatos essenciais). Minor accuracy issues include 'see if I could not learn' becoming 'descobrir se não poderia aprender' which slightly shifts the conditional tone, and 'suck out all the marrow' rendered as 'extrair até a medula' loses some of the visceral intensity of the original metaphor. results.translated_text: Chamem-me Ismael. Há alguns anos — não importa exatamente quantos — tendo pouco ou nenhum dinheiro na carteira e nada de especial que me interessasse na terra firme, pensei em navegar um pouco e ver a parte aquática do mundo. É um jeito que tenho de afastar a melancolia e regular a circulação. Sempre que me sinto amargurado, sempre que é um novembro úmido e chuvoso na minha alma, considero altura de partir para o mar o mais rápido possível.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves most meaning accurately, though 'amargurado' (embittered) is slightly weaker than 'grim' and 'altura de partir' is more colloquial than the original's formality. The archaic tone is partially maintained but lacks some of the philosophical weight and rhythmic cadence of Melville's opening.

results.translated_text: To jest prawdą powszechnie uznaną, że mężczyzna pojedynczy, posiadający duże majątki, musi pragnąć żony. Jakkolwiek mało znane mogą być uczucia lub poglądy takiego mężczyzny przy jego pierwszym wejściu do okolicy, ta prawda jest tak głęboko utkwiła w umysłach otaczających rodzin, że uważany jest on za właściwą własność którejś z ich córek.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning and ironic tone effectively, capturing Austen's satirical commentary on marriage and social expectations. Minor fluency issues exist ('ta prawda jest tak głęboko utkwiła' is slightly awkward) but overall it reads naturally and maintains the formal, period-appropriate style of the original.

results.translated_text: W studiu panował bogaty zapach róż, a gdy letni wiatr lekko poruszał gałęziami ogrodowych drzew, przez otwarte drzwi docierał ciężki aromat syringi albo bardziej delikatny zapach ciernistych róż różnobarwnych. Z kąta perskiego dywanu w kształcie siodła, na którym leżał, paląc jak zwykle liczne papierosy, lord Henryk Wotton mógł dostrzec błysk słodkich, miodowożółtych kwiatów glicynii.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meanings accurately but contains notable errors: 'syringi' (lilac) is correct, but 'ciernistych róż różnobarwnych' (thorny multicolored roses) misses 'pink-flowering thorn' specificity; 'perskiego dywanu w kształcie siodła' (Persian saddle-shaped carpet) awkwardly translates 'divan of Persian saddle-bags'; 'glicynii' (wisteria) incorrectly replaces 'laburnum.' The prose flows reasonably well but loses some of Wilde's sensory precision and aesthetic delicacy through

results.translated_text:
— Był pan w Afganistanie, widzę. — Jak diabli pan to poznał? — zapytałem zdumiony.
— Nie ma sprawy — odparł, chichocząc do siebie. — Teraz jednak chodzi o hemoglobinę. Nie ma wątpliwości, że pan dostrzega znaczenie mojego odkrycia?
— Chemicznie jest to pewnie interesujące — odpowiedziałem — ale praktycznie...
— Coż, panie, to najpraktyczniejsze odkrycie medycyno-prawne od lat! Nie widzi pan, że daje nam nieomylny test na plamy krwi?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately preserves the meaning and dialogue flow of the original, with excellent handling of Holmes's deductive manner and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include "Jak diabli" (colloquial) versus the more formal English original, and "medycyno-prawne" is a somewhat awkward compound, though functionally correct.

results.translated_text: Poszedłem do lasu, bo chciałem żyć świadomie, stawić twarzą tylko istotnym faktom życia i dowiedzieć się, co ma mi nauczyć, by przy końcu nie odkryć, że nie żyłem. Nie chciałem żyć tego, co nie jest życiem – bo życie jest tak cenne – ani nie chciałem praktykować rezygnacji, chyba że byłoby to konieczne. Chciałem żyć głęboko i wyciskać z życia każdą kroplę jego istoty.

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent well, with strong preservation of the deliberate, introspective tone. Minor issues include 'wyciskać z życia każdą kroplę jego istoty' (squeeze every drop of its essence) being slightly less vivid than the original 'suck out all the marrow,' and some slight awkwardness in phrasing that could be more naturally Polish.

results.translated_text: Nazywajcie mnie Izmailem. Kilka lat temu — niechaj nie będzie dokładnie określona ta liczba — mając w portfelu mało lub wcale pieniędzy i nic szczególnego, co by mnie na lądzie interesowało, pomyślałem, że wypłynę w morze i trochę pożegluję, by zobaczyć wodną część świata. To moja metoda na odganianie złośliwości i regulowanie krążenia. Zawsze bowiem, gdy czuję, jak moje usta stają się surowym rysem, gdy w duszy panuje ponury, mglisty listopad, uważam to za znak, że należy jak najszybciej wyrwać się w morze.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with only minor deviations (e.g., 'portfelu' for purse is slightly informal, 'surowym rysem' is an awkward rendering of 'grim about the mouth'). While the archaic tone is maintained reasonably well, some phrasings feel slightly stiff compared to the original's natural flow, and certain idioms lose their elegance in translation.

results.translated_text: 这是一个举世公认的真理：一个拥有良好财产的单身男子，必定渴望娶妻。无论他初到某个社区时内心的感受或想法如何，周围的家庭们早已将他视为自己女儿的合法归属，无论具体是哪一位。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures most of Austen's ironic tone, though 'rightful property' becomes 'legitimate belonging' which slightly softens the satirical edge. The prose flows naturally in Chinese with good sentence structure, though the opening could be more emphatic to match the original's declarative force.

results.translated_text: 屋内弥漫着玫瑰浓郁的芬芳，当轻柔的夏风穿过花园中的树木时，阵阵清香便从敞开的门缝中飘进来——有时是丁香那沉甸甸的馥郁，有时则是粉红色刺玫的清雅馨香。亨利·沃顿勋爵正躺在镶有波斯马鞍图案的长沙发上，照他惯常的习惯，点燃无数支香烟。从沙发的角落里，他隐约能看到蜜色甜美的金链花盛开的光影。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the sensory richness and aesthetic focus of Wilde's prose effectively, with accurate rendering of botanical details and atmospheric description. Minor deviations include slight restructuring of sentence flow and a somewhat more explicit explanation of Lord Henry's cigarette habit that slightly reduces the original's subtle elegance.

results.translated_text:
“看来你去过阿富汗吧？”我说道。
“你是怎么知道的？”我惊讶地问。
“不必管了，”他自言自语地笑道，“现在的问题是关于血红蛋白。你不觉得我的这个发现有重大意义吗？”
“化学上确实有趣，当然了，”我回答，“但实际应用呢——”
“伙计，这是多年来最实用的法医学发现之一。你不明白吗？这让我们能够对血迹进行无误的检验！”

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning and dialogue structure but contains a critical error: the first line incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to Watson ("我说道" should be "他说道"), reversing the speaker. While the vocabulary and tone are generally appropriate, this speaker attribution error significantly impacts accuracy, and some phrasing feels slightly stiff compared to the original's natural conversational flow.

results.translated_text: 我走进森林，是因为我想过一种有意识的生活，只面对生活中最本质的真相，看看是否能从中学到它想教我的一切。我不想在临死之际才发现自己从未真正活过。我并不想虚度此生，因为生命如此珍贵；我也不愿轻易放弃，除非万不得已。我渴望深度地生活，尽情汲取生命的精华。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage with strong fidelity, though some nuances are slightly softened. The prose flows naturally in Chinese, though the rhythmic intensity and paradoxical constructions of the original (e.g., 'living is so dear') lose some of their philosophical punch in the target language.

results.translated_text: 我是伊斯梅尔。多年前——具体多久不重要——口袋里几乎没有钱，岸上也没有什么特别吸引我的事，于是我想出海漂泊一番，看看这水天一色的世界。这是我驱散郁闷、调节心情的一种方式。每当我发现自己嘴角渐渐阴沉；每当我的心灵变成阴沉沉的十一月天气，我就认为该尽快出海了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and maintains most narrative elements, though some nuances are lost—notably 'spleen' becomes generic 'gloom' and 'regulating the circulation' is simplified to 'adjusting mood,' diminishing the Victorian medical philosophy. The archaic literary tone is partially preserved but reads somewhat more modern and colloquial than the contemplative, formal original.

results.translated_text: 這是一條舉世公認的真理：凡是擁有豐厚財產的單身男子，必定渴望尋覓一位妻子。雖然這樣的男子初入鄰里時，其心思與想法可能鮮為人知，但這項真理已深植於周遭家庭的心中，以至於他們認為他理所當然是他們某位千金的合適對象。

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and ironic tone of Austen's opening, with natural Chinese phrasing that preserves the formal, satirical voice. Minor stylistic variations (e.g., '理所當然是...的合適對象' vs. the more possessive 'rightful property') slightly soften the original's biting irony, but overall the translation is faithful and reads smoothly.

results.translated_text: 屋內瀰漫著玫瑰濃郁的芬芳，當輕柔的夏風穿梭過花園的樹木，一陣陣丁香濃重的香氣或是更細膩的粉紅蔷薇刺花香，便從敞開的門中飄進來。在角落裡，亨利·沃頓勛爵（Lord Henry Wotton）懶洋洋地躺在波斯馬鞍形的長沙發上，照他慣常的樣子，不斷地抽著無數根香煙。從沙發的角落，他正好能看到蜜色甜美的金鐵木花朵的閃光。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements and sensory details but has structural awkwardness and some botanical inaccuracies ("粉紅蔷薇刺花" is unclear; "laburnum" should be "金鏈花" not "金鐵木"). The final sentence is fragmented and disrupts the flowing aesthetic prose of the original, and the phrase "懶洋洋地躺" adds interpretation not present in the source.

results.translated_text:
「你曾經去過阿富汗吧？」我驚訝地問道：「你怎麼知道的？」
「別管了，」他自顧自地笑著說，「現在的問題是關於血紅素。你不覺得我的這項發現具有重要意義嗎？」
「化學上當然有趣，」我回答說，「但實際應用上——」
「哎呀，這可是多年來最實用的醫法鑑定發現！你難道看不出這能讓我們找到一種絕對可靠的血跡檢驗方法嗎？」

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure well, but has some issues: the opening attribution is reversed (should be Holmes speaking first), and 'medico-legal' is translated as '醫法鑑定' which is somewhat awkward. The tone and character voice are mostly preserved, though the exclamatory style feels slightly less natural than the original.

results.translated_text: 我走進森林，是因為想要過一種有意義的生活，只面對生命中最本質的事實，看看能否從中學習它想傳授的東西，而不至於在臨死之際才發現自己從未真正活過。我不願意虛度此生，因為生命實在太珍貴；我也不願意輕易放棄，除非萬不得已。我只想深深地活著，將生命中的每一滴精華都汲取乾淨。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage with strong fidelity, though some nuances are slightly altered—'有意義的生活' (meaningful life) softens the deliberateness of 'deliberately,' and '將生命中的每一滴精華都汲取乾淨' adds specificity not in the original. The prose flows naturally in Chinese with appropriate philosophical weight, though the rhythm and parallelism of Thoreau's original English style are somewhat diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: 我是伊斯梅爾。幾年前——不必細算是幾年之前——口袋裡幾乎沒有錢，岸上也沒有什麼特別吸引我的事物，於是我決定出海漂泊一番，看看這片水域的世界。這是我排遣鬱悶、調節血氣的方式。每當我發現自己嘴角漸漸變得陰沉；每當心靈裡飄來陰鬱潮濕的十一月天氣，我就認為該是盡快出海的時候了。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and philosophical tone of Melville's opening, with good preservation of the metaphorical language about melancholy and the sea. However, some nuances are slightly softened—'driving off the spleen' becomes '排遣鬱悶' (dispelling gloom) which loses the specific medical-humoral reference, and the archaic, conversational intimacy of the original prose feels marginally more formal in Chinese.

results.translated_text: 世間に広く認められた真理といえども、財産を持つ独身男性が必ず妻を求めるものである、ということである。そのような男性の心情や考えが、初めて近所に住み着いた時どのようなものであったとしても、周囲の家族たちは、彼が自らの娘のいずれかの正当な相手であると見なすほど、この真理は彼らの心に深く根付いている。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but struggles with fluency and stylistic elegance. The sentence structure becomes convoluted in Japanese, losing some of Austen's characteristic wit and the famous opening's punchy irony, though the essential content is preserved.

results.translated_text: スタジオはバラの豊かな香りで満ちていた。軽やかな夏の風が庭の木々の間を通り過ぎると、開けっぴろげのドアからは、ラベンダーの重厚な香りや、ピンクの花を咲かせるイチゴバラの繊細な香りが漂ってきた。ペルシア風の鞍袋を模したディバンの角に横たわり、いつものように無数の煙草を吸っていたヘンリー・ウォトン卿は、その隅から、ミツバチのような甘美で金色の花を咲かせるエゾヤナギの光沢をかろうじて見ることができた。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general sensory richness but contains significant botanical errors (lilac→ラベンダー, pink-flowering thorn→イチゴバラ, laburnum→エゾヤナギ) that distort Wilde's specific aesthetic imagery. While the prose flows reasonably well in Japanese, these inaccuracies undermine both fidelity and the author's carefully chosen symbolism, and the phrasing occasionally feels awkward rather than maintaining Wilde's elegant, flowing style.

results.translated_text:
「あなたはアフガニスタンに行ったことがあるのですね」
「一体どうやってお気付きになったのですか？」と私は驚いて尋ねました。
「気にしないでください」と彼はくすくす笑いながら言いました。「今の問題はヘモグロビンについてです。私のこの発見の意義はおわかりでしょう？」
「化学的には興味深いことは確かですが、実際には……」
「おや、これは数年ぶりの画期的な法医学的発見ですよ。血痕の確実な検出法を与えてくれるのをご覧になれないのですか？」

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and maintains the logical flow of the dialogue, though some phrasings are slightly awkward (e.g., 'おや、これは数年ぶりの画期的な法医学的発見ですよ' is somewhat verbose). The formal Japanese register is appropriate for the Victorian-era source material, but occasional constructions feel more translated than naturally Japanese.

results.translated_text: 森に行ったのは、意識的に生きるためだった。生きるというものの本質に直面し、人生が教えてくれるものを学びたいと願ったからだ。そして、死に臨むときに「生きてこなかった」と後悔することのないように。生きることは何よりも貴重なものだから、無意味な生を送りたいとは思わなかった。また、あきらめを身につけるのも、本当に必要な場合だけにしたいと考えた。私は深く生き、人生の骨髄まで吸い尽くしたいと望んだのだ。

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and meaning of Thoreau's passage well, with accurate rendering of key concepts like deliberate living and extracting life's marrow. The fluency is natural and readable in Japanese, though some of Thoreau's parallel structure and rhythmic intensity are slightly diminished in the target language.

results.translated_text: 私をイシュマエルと呼べ。何年か前のことだ—正確な年数はどうでもよいが—ポケットにほとんど金もなく、陸に興味を引くようなものもないまま、私は少し航海して世界の水の部分を見て回ろうと考えた。それは私の気分を晴らし、血行を整える方法なのだ。口元が陰気になってくる時、心の中が霧雨の十一月に包まれるような時、私はできるだけ早く海へ出る時だと考える。

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some nuance (e.g., 'spleen' as a medical/emotional concept, the poetic 'watery part of the world'). The Japanese reads somewhat stiffly and fails to replicate Melville's archaic, contemplative tone—it feels more modern and less introspective than the original's philosophical cadence.

results.translated_text: 세상 누구나 인정하듯, 재산이 많은 독신 남자가 있다면 그는 반드시 아내를 원할 것이다. 그가 새 이웃에 처음 들어왔을 때 그의 마음이나 생각 따위는 얼마나 잘 알려져 있든, 주변의 가족들은 이미 그의 존재를 통해 어떤 딸에게나 적합한 남편감으로 여기며, 그가 그들의 딸 중 한 명의 당연한 소유물로 여겨진다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise but loses some nuance in the original's sardonic tone and elegant structure. The sentence construction becomes awkward and convoluted, particularly in the second sentence where the flow and clarity suffer compared to Austen's measured prose.

results.translated_text: 공작 헨리 워턴은 평소처럼 무수히 많은 담배를 피우며 페르시아 가죽으로 만든 디반 모서리에 누워 있었다. 방 안은 장미의 풍부한 향기로 가득 차 있었고, 여름 바람이 정원에서 나무 사이로 스치면 열린 문으로부터는 자스민의 무거운 향기나 분홍꽃이 피는 가시나무의 섬세한 향기가 흘러 들어왔다. 그는 그 향기 속에서, 꿀처럼 달콤하고 황금빛 꽃을 피우는 금합欢의 빛나는 꽃을 간신히 볼 수 있었다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the general meaning and sensory elements but contains significant issues: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'jasmine' (자스민), disrupting the specific floral imagery; the sentence structure is reorganized substantially, altering the original's flowing aesthetic rhythm; and the poetic quality of Wilde's prose is diminished by more straightforward phrasing, losing the refined sensuality that defines this passage's style.

results.translated_text:
"아프가니스탄에 다녀오셨던 모양이군요."
"어찌 아셨습니까?" 내가 놀라서 물었다.
"그건 상관없소." 그는 혼자서 키득거리며 말했다. "현재의 문제는 혈색소에 관한 것이네. 내 발견의 중요성을 아시겠죠?"
"화학적으로는 흥미로운 것 같긴 하지만, 실용적으로는—"
"뭐, 친구야, 이건 몇 년 만에 가장 실용적인 법의학적 발견이오. 혈흔의 확실한 검출 방법을 우리에게 제공한다는 걸 못 보나?"

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue structure, preserving Holmes's deductive nature and Watson's astonishment. Minor fluency issues include slightly formal phrasing in places (e.g., '다녀오셨던 모양이군요' is somewhat stiff) and the tone shift from Holmes's casual dismissal to his enthusiastic explanation could be smoother, but overall the character voices and Victorian-era formality are reasonably well maintained.

results.translated_text: 나는 숲으로 갔는데, 그것은 내가 의도적으로 살기를 원했기 때문이다. 삶의 본질적인 사실들만 마주하고, 삶이 가르쳐 줄 것을 배워 보고 싶었고, 죽어갈 때 ‘살지 않았다’는 사실을 발견하지 않기를 바랐기 때문이다. 나는 그저 살아가는 것만이 소중한데도, 그보다 더한 삶을 살고 싶지 않았다. 그리고 필요하지 않다면, 단념을 연습하고 싶지도 않았다. 나는 깊이 살고 싶었고, 삶의 모든 맛을 뽑아내려 했다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses some philosophical nuance and poetic rhythm of Thoreau's original prose. The structure becomes more fragmented and explanatory rather than maintaining the flowing, meditative quality of the source text.

results.translated_text: 나를 이스마엘이라고 불러라. 몇 년 전이었는지—정확한 시간은 중요하지 않지만—주머니에 돈도 거의 없고, 육지에서 특별히 흥미를 끌 만한 것도 없던 나는 바다를 조금 돌아다니며 수면 아래의 세상을 보기로 했다. 그것은 내 spleen을 달래고 혈액 순환을 조절하는 방식이다. 입술이 엄숙해지는 느낌이 들 때마다, 내 영혼이 음울한 11월의 비가 내리는 날처럼 되기 시작하면, 나는 가능한 한 빨리 바다로 떠나야 한다고 생각한다.

scores.feedback: The translation captures basic meaning but has significant issues: 'spleen' is left untranslated in Korean, 'watery part of the world' becomes awkwardly 'water below the surface,' and the archaic, contemplative tone is lost in favor of more modern phrasing. The poetic melancholy of the original is diminished.

results.translated_text: Đây là một chân lý mà ai cũng thừa nhận: một người đàn ông độc thân, giàu có, chắc chắn sẽ tìm vợ. Dù cảm xúc và suy nghĩ của người đàn ông ấy có ít được biết đến đến mức nào khi anh ta mới đến một vùng lân cận, nhưng chân lý này đã được khắc sâu trong tâm trí của những gia đình xung quanh đến mức họ coi anh ta như một tài sản hợp pháp của một trong những cô con gái của họ.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone well, with accurate rendering of the key concepts. However, the Vietnamese phrasing is somewhat awkward in places ("ít được biết đến đến mức nào" has redundancy), and the elegant, flowing irony of Austen's original is slightly diminished by more literal construction choices.

results.translated_text: Phòng studio ngập tràn mùi hương hoa hồng dày đặc, và khi gió mùa hè nhẹ nhàng thổi qua những cây trong vườn, mùi thơm nặng nề của cây nhung nhang hoặc hương nhẹ nhàng hơn của cây gai hoa hồng hồng lại tràn vào qua cửa sổ mở. Từ góc sofa có hình túi yên ngựa Ba Tư mà ông Henry Wotton đang nằm, như thường lệ, hút thuốc lá không ngừng nghỉ, ông có thể nhìn thấy ánh sáng lung linh của những bông hoa vàng ngọt ngào từ cây trám vàng.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but loses some aesthetic precision—'cửa sổ mở' (open window) should be 'cửa mở' (open door), and 'ánh sáng lung linh' (twinkling light) doesn't fully convey the delicate 'gleam' of the original. The sensory richness and Wildean aestheticism are somewhat diminished by awkward phrasing like 'hút thuốc lá không ngừng nghỉ' (smoke cigarettes without stopping) which feels clunky compared to the elegant original.

results.translated_text:
"Tôi đã từng ở Afghanistan, tôi đoán được đấy." "Làm thế nào anh biết được điều đó?" Tôi hỏi ngạc nhiên. "Không cần nói nữa," anh ta cười thầm. "Bây giờ thì câu hỏi là về hemoglobin. Chắc chắn anh đã hiểu ý nghĩa của phát hiện này của tôi?" "Điều này thú vị về mặt hóa học, không nghi ngờ gì," tôi trả lời, "nhưng về mặt thực tiễn—"
"À, anh ơi, đây là phát hiện y pháp thực tiễn nhất trong nhiều năm qua. Anh không thấy rằng nó cho chúng ta một phương pháp kiểm tra vết máu không thể sai lầm nào không?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: the first line incorrectly attributes Holmes's observation to Watson, and the dialogue structure is confused throughout. Fluency suffers from awkward phrasing ('không nghi ngờ gì' is redundant, 'À, anh ơi' is informal for Holmes's character) and the style doesn't match the Victorian detective fiction tone of the original.

results.translated_text: Tôi đã đến rừng vì muốn sống một cách có ý thức, đối mặt với những thực tại cơ bản nhất của cuộc đời, và tìm hiểu xem cuộc sống có thể dạy cho tôi những gì, để khi đến lúc chết, tôi không phải nhận ra mình chưa từng sống. Tôi không muốn sống những điều không phải là cuộc sống, vì sống là quý giá đến thế; cũng không muốn chấp nhận sự từ bỏ nếu không thật sự cần thiết. Tôi muốn sống một cách sâu sắc, hút cạn từng giọt tinh túy của cuộc đời.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's philosophical meaning and existential urgency, with strong equivalents like 'có ý thức' for 'deliberately' and 'hút cạn từng giọt tinh túy' for 'suck out all the marrow.' Minor fluency variations occur in the middle section where Vietnamese syntax creates slightly different rhythms than the original's parallel structure.

results.translated_text: Gọi tôi là Ishmael. Một thời gian trước đây—không cần nói chính xác bao lâu—vì túi tiền của tôi gần như trống rỗng, và không có gì đặc biệt để tôi quan tâm trên bờ, tôi nghĩ mình sẽ đi du hành trên biển một chút, khám phá phần thế giới nước mặn. Đó là cách tôi xua tan nỗi buồn rầu và điều hòa dòng máu. Mỗi khi tôi cảm thấy miệng mình trở nên khắc nghiệt, mỗi khi tâm hồn tôi như một ngày mưa gió tháng Mười một ẩm ướt, tôi cho rằng đó là lúc phải ra khơi càng sớm càng tốt.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately but loses some nuance in the philosophical tone and archaic style. Phrases like 'watery part of the world' become 'phần thế giới nước mặn' (salty world), and the poetic melancholy of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is somewhat flattened, reducing the original's introspective depth and literary elegance.

เป็นความจริงที่รับรู้กันทั่วไปว่า ผู้ชายคนเดียวที่มีทรัพย์สมบัติมากมาย จะต้องต้องการหาแต่งงานเสมอ
แม้ความรู้สึกหรือความคิดของผู้ชายเช่นนี้จะไม่เป็นที่รู้จักมากนักเมื่อเขามาเข้าสู่ชุมชนแห่งใด

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise accurately, but the Thai phrasing feels somewhat stilted and loses some of Austen's elegant irony through awkward constructions like 'จะต้องต้องการ' (double verb) and overly literal renderings that don't flow naturally in Thai.

results.translated_text: ห้องสตูดิโอเต็มไปด้วยกลิ่นหอมอร่อยของดอกกุหลาบ เมื่อลมฤดูร้อนที่อ่อนโยนพัดผ่านต้นไม้ในสวน ผ่านประตูที่เปิดกว้างก็พัดพามากลิ่นหอมหนักของดอกไลลัก หรือกลิ่นหอมอ่อน ๆ ของดอกกุหลาบสีชมพูบนกิ่งหนาม จากมุมของเตียงเปอร์เซียที่มีรูปแบบเหมือนกระเป๋าแสวงของม้า ซึ่งเขานอนอยู่ขณะสูบบุหรี่ตามนิสัยของเขา ลอร์ดเฮนรี วอตตัน สามารถมองเห็นแสงสว่างอ่อน ๆ ของดอกไม้สีเหลืองอมน้ำผึ้งจากต้นแคร์ร็อบที่อยู่ใกล้ ๆ ได้เล็กน้อย

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements and sensory details, but struggles with natural Thai phrasing and loses some aesthetic elegance. The rendering of 'Persian saddle-bags' as 'กระเป๋าแสวงของม้า' is awkward, and the cumulative sensory flow feels choppy rather than flowing like Wilde's original prose.

results.translated_text:
“คุณเคยไปอัฟกานิสถานใช่ไหม” “คุณรู้ได้อย่างไรเล่า” ฉันถามด้วยความประหลาดใจ
“ไม่ต้องสนใจ” เขาพูดขณะหัวเราะเงียบๆ “ปัญหาที่สำคัญอยู่ที่ฮีโมโกลบินนี้เลย คุณเห็นความสำคัญของการค้นพบของฉันแล้วไหม”
“น่าสนใจทางเคมีแน่นอน” ฉันตอบ “แต่ในทางปฏิบัติ—”
“อะไรเล่า พี่ชาย เรื่องนี้เป็นการค้นพบทางการแพทย์และกฎหมายที่น่าเชื่อถือที่สุดในหลายปีเลย คุณไม่เห็นว่ามันช่วยให้เราทดสอบรอยเลือดได้อย่างแน่นอนไหม”

scores.feedback: The translation captures most meaning accurately, though 'พี่ชาย' (older brother) is an odd choice for addressing Watson and slightly misses the tone. The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly in Thai with awkward phrasing like 'ปัญหาที่สำคัญอยู่ที่' and 'น่าเชื่อถือที่สุด' that don't fully match the original's natural Victorian conversational style.

results.translated_text: ผมเดินเข้าไปในป่าเพราะต้องการอยู่ชีวิตอย่างตั้งใจ ต้องการเผชิญหน้ากับความจริงที่สำคัญของชีวิตเพียงอย่างเดียว และอยากรู้ว่าชีวิตจะสอนผมอะไรได้บ้าง และเมื่อวันตายมาถึง ผมอยากไม่ให้พบว่าตนไม่เคยใช้ชีวิตเลย ผมไม่ต้องการใช้ชีวิตแบบไม่ใช่ชีวิตเลย เพราะชีวิตมีค่ามากเกินไป ผมก็ไม่ต้องการยอมรับอย่างไม่จำเป็น เว้นแต่จะเป็นสิ่งจำเป็น ผมต้องการใช้ชีวิตอย่างลึกซึ้ง และดูดซับสารสำคัญทุกอย่างของชีวิตให้หมดสิ้น

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's core philosophical meanings accurately, though some nuances are lost—particularly the poetic rhythm of 'suck out all the marrow of life' becomes more literal as 'ดูดซับสารสำคัญ.' The Thai reads somewhat awkwardly with repetitive phrasing ('ชีวิต' appears excessively) and loses the elegant parallelism of the original's structure, affecting both fluency and the contemplative tone essential to Thoreau's philosophical prose.

results.translated_text:
ขอเรียกฉันว่า อิชเมล นั่นเอง บางปีที่ผ่านมา—ไม่ต้องสนใจว่าผ่านไปแค่ไหน—เมื่อกระเป๋าของฉันว่างเปล่า ไม่มีเงินเลย ไม่มีอะไรน่าสนใจบนบก ฉันจึงคิดว่าจะออกเดินเรือไปไกลๆ เล็กน้อย และมองโลกที่อยู่ข้างน้ำดูสักหน่อย นี่เป็นวิธีหนึ่งของฉันในการขับไล่ความเศร้าโศก และปรับสมดุลการไหลเวียนของชีวิต

ทุกครั้งที่ฉันรู้สึกเหมือนจะหยาบคายขึ้นมา ทุกครั้งที่ความรู้สึกในใจฉันกลายเป็นเดือนพฤศจิกายนที่ชื้นชืดและฝนตกตลอด ทุกครั้งนั้น ฉันก็คิดว่าเป็นเวลาที่ดีแล้วที่จะออกเดินทางไปทะเลทันทีที่ฉันทำได้

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and philosophical intent of Melville's opening, but loses some archaic elegance and poetic precision in the target language. Phrases like 'ขับไล่ความเศร้าโศก' (driving off melancholy) and 'ปรับสมดุลการไหลเวียนของชีวิต' (regulating life's circulation) feel slightly awkward and don't fully convey the original's sophisticated tone; the metaphorical weight of 'spleen' and 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' is somewhat diminished in Thai rendering.

results.translated_text: यह एक सार्वभौमिक सत्य है कि एक अकेला, धनवान पुरुष अवश्य ही किसी पत्नी की तलाश में रहता है। चाहे वह व्यक्ति अपने आसपास के मोहल्ले में पहली बार आया हो और उसकी भावनाएँ या विचार कितने ही गोपनीय हों, फिर भी आसपास के परिवारों के मन में यह धारणा इतनी मजबूत होती है कि वे उसे अपने किसी एक बेटी का स्वाभाविक अधिकार मान लेते हैं।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic tone effectively, though some nuances are slightly softened. The sentence structure becomes more complex in Hindi, affecting natural readability while maintaining the satirical voice reasonably well.

results.translated_text: कमरे में गुलाबों की समृद्ध सुगंध भरी हुई थी, और जब हल्की ग्रीष्म की हवा बाग़ के पेड़ों के बीच से बहती, तो खुली दरवाज़े से लिलाक़ की भारी खुशबू आती, या फिर गुलाबी फूलों वाली कांटेदार झाड़ी की कोमल सुगंध। पर्शियन सैडल-बैगों से बनी दिवान की कोने पर, जहाँ वह अपनी आदत के अनुसार सिगरेटें पी रहा था, लॉर्ड हेनरी वॉटन को एक लाबर्नम के मधुर और मधुर रंग के फूलों की चमक दिखाई दे रही थी।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key meanings and sensory details but has notable issues: 'smoking, as was his custom, innumerable cigarettes' is awkwardly rendered as 'सिगरेटें पी रहा था' (smoking cigarettes), losing the nuance of 'innumerable'; the phrase structure becomes clunky in places, particularly the long final sentence; and the aesthetic refinement of Wilde's prose—his careful balance of sensory precision and elegance—is somewhat diminished by more utilitarian Hindi phrasing.

results.translated_text:
आपने अफगानिस्तान में तो समय बिताया होगा।" "पृथ्वी पर यह कैसे पता चला?" मैं आश्चर्य से पूछा। "भूल जाइए," वह हँसते हुए बोला। "अब सवाल है हीमोग्लोबिन का। मेरी इस खोज का महत्व आप समझ ही गए होंगे न?"
"हाँ, रासायनिक दृष्टि से तो यह निश्चित रूप से दिलचस्प है," मैंने उत्तर दिया, "लेकिन व्यावहारिक रूप से—"
"क्या, भाई! यह वर्षों में सबसे व्यावहारिक चिकित्सा-विधिक खोज है। क्या आप नहीं देखते कि यह हमें खून के धब्बों के लिए एक अचूक परीक्षण देता है?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure well, with accurate rendering of the scientific discussion and character interaction. However, some nuances are lost—'Never mind' becomes 'भूल जाइए' (forget it) rather than a more dismissive equivalent, and the conversational rhythm differs slightly from the original's Victorian formality, affecting the period style preservation.

results.translated_text: मैं जंगल गया क्योंकि मैं सचमुच जीना चाहता था—जीवन के मूल सत्यों का सामना करना, देखना कि क्या मैं उसके पाठ को समझ सकता हूँ, और जब मृत्यु आये, तो पता चले कि मैंने जीना ही नहीं सीखा। मैं ऐसा जीवन नहीं जीना चाहता था जो जीवन न हो, क्योंकि जीना इतना प्यारा है; और न ही मैं त्याग को अभ्यास करना चाहता था, जब तक कि वह बिल्कुल ज़रूरी न हो। मैं गहरे से जीना चाहता था, जीवन के हर स्वाद को चखना, हर तत्व को निचोड़ना।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the philosophical essence and most key meanings of Thoreau's passage, with good rendering of the paradoxical logic and existential themes. Minor issues include slight awkwardness in phrasing ('पाठ को समझ सकता हूँ' is somewhat literal), a minor meaning shift in the negative construction, and the final phrase 'हर स्वाद को चखना, हर तत्व को निचोड़ना' adds interpretation beyond the original's 'suck out all the marrow,' though it captures the spirit well.

results.translated_text: मुझे इस्माइल कहो। कुछ साल पहले—जितना ठीक से कहूं, उतना मतलब नहीं—जेब में पैसों की कमी थी और तट पर कुछ ऐसा नहीं था जो मेरी रुचि जगाता, तो मैंने सोचा कि थोड़ा सा समुद्र में भटकूंगा और दुनिया के जलराशि वाले हिस्से को देखूं। यह मेरी ऐसी आदत है जो मन की कड़वाहट को दूर करती है और रक्तसंचार को संतुलित रखती है। जब भी मैं अपने मुँह पर कड़वाहट महसूस करता हूँ; जब भी मेरा दिल नवंबर की गीली, धुंधली बारिश जैसा हो जाता है, तो मैं समझता हूँ कि जल्द से जल्द समुद्र की ओर निकलना चाहिए।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and narrative voice reasonably well, but loses some of Melville's archaic elegance and philosophical depth. Phrases like 'भटकूंगा' (wander) and 'कड़वाहट' (bitterness) are somewhat colloquial for the elevated literary tone, and the metaphorical richness of 'damp, drizzly November in my soul' becomes more literal and less evocative in Hindi.

results.translated_text: একটি সর্বজনীন সত্য যে, ভালো সম্পত্তির অধিকারী একক একজন পুরুষ অবশ্যই স্ত্রীর প্রয়োজন হবে। এমন একজন পুরুষের প্রথমে কোনো এলাকায় প্রবেশ করলেও তার অনুভূতি বা মতামত কতটা পরিচিত না হোক, এই সত্যটি চারপাশের পরিবারগুলোর মনে এতটাই গভীরভাবে প্রতিষ্ঠিত যে, তাকে তাদের কন্যাদের মধ্যে কারো একজনের অধিকার বলে বিবেচনা করা হয়।

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise accurately, but the sentence structure becomes awkward and convoluted in Bengali, losing some of Austen's elegant simplicity and biting irony. The phrasing 'অধিকার বলে বিবেচনা করা হয়' (considered as property/right) works but feels less sharp than the original's satirical edge.

results.translated_text: অতিথি শালায় গোলাপের মিষ্টি গন্ধে ভরপুর ছিল। যখন হালকা গ্রীষ্মের বাতাস বাগানের গাছপালার মাঝে খেলা করত, তখন খোলা দরজার দিয়ে প্রবেশ করত লিলাকের ভারী গন্ধ অথবা গোলাপি কাঁটাবনস্পতির হালকা সুগন্ধ। পার্সিয়ান স্যাডলব্যাগের ডিভানের কোণে, যেখানে তিনি তার অভ্যাস মতো অসংখ্য সিগারেট ধূমপান করছিলেন, লর্ড হেনরি ওয়টন মাত্র লেবার্নামের মধুস্বাদু ও মধুরঙা ফুলের চমক দেখতে পাচ্ছিলেন।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory details and aesthetic qualities of the original, with accurate rendering of floral imagery and Lord Henry's character. However, the Bengali phrasing is somewhat awkward in places (e.g., 'অতিথি শালায়' for 'studio' is imprecise, and the sentence structure feels overly complex), which slightly diminishes the natural flow that Wilde's prose achieves.

results.translated_text: "আপনি আফগানিস্তানে ছিলেন, আমি অনুমান করছি।" "কীভাবে জানলেন?" অবাক হয়ে জিজ্ঞাসা করলাম। "কিছু না, কিছু না," হেসে বললেন তিনি নিজেই। "এখন প্রশ্ন হচ্ছে হিমোগ্লোবিনের। আমার এই আবিষ্কারের গুরুত্ব আপনি বুঝতে পারছেন না কি?" "রাসায়নিক দিক থেকে অবশ্যই তা আকর্ষণীয়," আমি উত্তর দিলাম, "কিন্তু ব্যবহারিক দিক থেকে—" "কেন, মানুষ, এটি বছর ধরে সবচেয়ে ব্যবহারিক মেডিকো-লিগ্যাল আবিষ্কার। আপনি দেখছেন না, এটি আমাদের রক্তের দাগের জন্য একটি অপরিবর্তনীয় পরীক্ষা দেয়?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though 'কিছু না, কিছু না' (nothing, nothing) is awkward for 'Never mind' and 'অপরিবর্তনীয়' (unchangeable) is less precise than 'infallible.' The dialogue reads somewhat stiffly in Bengali with occasional awkward phrasing that detracts from the natural Victorian-era conversational tone of the original.

results.translated_text: আমি বনে গিয়েছিলাম কারণ আমি জীবনকে সুস্পষ্টভাবে বাঁচতে চেয়েছিলাম—জীবনের মৌলিক সত্যগুলিকেই মুখোমুখি হতে, দেখতে চেয়েছিলাম কি শিখতে পারি তার কাছ থেকে, এবং যখন মৃত্যুর মুখোমুখি হব, তখন জানতে পারি যে আমি জীবনকে বাঁচিনি। আমি এমন জীবন বাঁচতে চাইনি যা জীবন নয়; জীবন তো এতই মূল্যবান! আর আমি এমনই আত্মসমর্পণ করতে চাইনি, যদি তা সম্পূর্ণ প্রয়োজনীয় না হয়। আমি গভীরভাবে বাঁচতে চেয়েছিলাম, জীবনের প্রতিটি রস আহরণ করতে—জীবনের মজ্জা শুষে নিতে।

scores.feedback: The translation captures Thoreau's philosophical intent and key concepts with strong fidelity, preserving the emphasis on deliberate living and existential depth. Minor fluency issues arise from slightly awkward phrasing ("যখন মৃত্যুর মুখোমুখি হব" for "when I came to die") and the somewhat convoluted structure in places, though the poetic style and contemplative tone are well-maintained overall.

results.translated_text: আমাকে ইশমায়েল বলো। কত বছর আগের কথা—কতটা সঠিকভাবে বলা যাবে না—কিন্তু যখন আমার পকেটে টাকার অভাব ছিল, আর জমিনে কোনো বিশেষ কিছু আমার মনোযোগ আকর্ষণ করতে পারছিল না, তখন আমি ভাবলাম সামুদ্রিক বিশ্বের এই জলজ অংশটিকে একটু ঘুরে দেখে আসব। এটি আমার এমন এক উপায়, যাতে আমি মনকে শান্ত করতে পারি এবং রক্তপ্রবাহকে নিয়ন্ত্রণ করতে পারি। যখন আমি মুখে কুঁদে যেতে শুরু করি, যখন আমার আত্মা ভিজে ভিজে নভেম্বরের মতো হয়ে ওঠে, তখন আমি মনে করি যত দ্রুত সম্ভব সমুদ্রে যাওয়ার সময় এসেছে।

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but loses some nuance; 'জমিনে' (land/ground) is less poetic than 'shore,' and 'মুখে কুঁদে যেতে' (grimace at mouth) is awkward. The archaic, meditative tone of the original is somewhat diluted by more literal phrasing and less flowing rhythm in Bengali.

results.translated_text: ஒரு நல்ல செல்வந்தனாகிய ஒருவனின் மனநிலை, கருத்துக்கள் என்னவாக இருந்தாலும், அவன் முதன்முதலாக ஒரு பகுதிக்கு வந்தவுடன், அவனுக்கு மனைவி தேவைப்படும் என்ற உண்மை, அங்கு வாழும் குடும்பங்களின் மனதில் ஆழமாக பதிந்திருக்கும். அப்படிப்பட்ட ஒரு ஆணின் மனநிலை, கருத்துக்கள் எவ்வளவு அறியப்படாமலிருந்தாலும், அவன் அங்கு வந்தவுடன், அவனுக்கு அவ்விடத்தின் ஏதாவது ஒரு பெண்ணை மணமுடிக்க வேண்டும் என்றே கருதப்படுகிறது.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but loses the opening's iconic ironic punch and universal scope. The sentence structure becomes convoluted and repetitive, failing to preserve Austen's elegant irony and the satirical tone that defines this famous opening.

results.translated_text: கூடத்தில் மல்லிகையின் செழிப்பான மணம் பரவியிருந்தது. பூங்காவின் இளமையான கோடைக்காற்று மரங்களுக்கிடையே பாய்ந்தபோது, திறந்த வாசலின் வழியாக லிலாகின் கனமான மணம் அல்லது சற்று மெல்லிய பிங்க் பூக்களைக் கொண்ட காந்தி மணம் உள்ளே வந்தது. பெர்சியன் சாட் பைகளால் ஆன டிவானின் ஒரு மூலையில், வழக்கமாக புகையிலை புகைப்பதற்காகப் படுத்திருந்த லார்ட் ஹென்றி வாட்டன், மெல்லிய பூக்களைக் கொண்ட லபர்னம் மரத்தின் மெல்லிய, தேனைப் போலப் பழுப்பு நிறமும், தேனைப் போலப் புளிப்பான மணமும் கொண்ட பூக்களின் ஒளிர்வை சற்று பார்த்தார்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most key elements but contains significant issues: 'மல்லிகை' (jasmine) replaces roses, disrupting the original flower imagery; awkward phrasing like 'தேனைப் போலப் புளிப்பான மணம்' (honey-like sour scent) contradicts itself; the sensuous flow and aesthetic refinement of Wilde's prose is lost in clunky, overly literal constructions that don't read naturally in Tamil.

results.translated_text:
"ஆப்கானிஸ்தானில் இருந்தீர்கள், எனக்குத் தெரிகிறது" என்றார்.
"ஏன்? எப்படி அறிந்தீர்கள்?" என்னிடம் ஆச்சரியத்துடன் கேட்டேன்.
"அதைப் பற்றி கவலைப்படாதீர்கள்," என்று சிரித்துக்கொண்டே கூறினார். "இப்போது குருதிக்குழம்பு பற்றிய விவாதம். எனது கண்டுபிடிப்பின் முக்கியத்துவத்தை நீங்கள் புரிந்துகொண்டிருக்கிறீர்களா?"
"ரசாயன ரீதியாக அது ஆர்வமூட்டுவதாக இருக்கலாம், அது சரி," எனக் கூறினேன், "ஆனால் நடைமுறையில்—"
"ஏன், மனிதனே, இது பல ஆண்டுகளாக மருத்துவ-சட்ட ரீதியாக மிகவும் பயனுள்ள கண்டுபிடிப்பு. நீங்கள் புரிந்துகொள்ளவில்லை என்றால், இது குருதி கறைகளுக்கான தவறாமல் செயல்படும் பரிசோதனை முறையை நமக்குக் கொடுக்கிறது."

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and dialogue structure reasonably well, preserving key plot points like the Afghanistan reference and the haemoglobin discovery. However, some phrases feel awkwardly constructed (e.g., 'குருதிக்குழம்பு' for haemoglobin is somewhat clinical), and the natural conversational flow and Victorian-era formality of the original are partially lost, making it read more like a literal translation than natural Tamil dialogue.

results.translated_text: நான் காடுகளுக்குச் சென்றேன், ஏனென்றால் வாழ்வை நனவாக வாழ்வதற்காக, வாழ்வின் அடிப்படை உண்மைகளையே முகம்கொண்டு வாழ்வதற்காக, வாழ்வின் கற்பிக்கும் பாடங்களை அறியாமல் இறந்து போகாமல், வாழ்ந்ததா என்னும் சந்தேகத்துடன் இறக்காமல் இருக்க வேண்டும் என்ற ஆசையுடன். வாழ்க்கை இவ்வளவு அரியதென்றால், வாழ்க்கையல்லாத வாழ்வை வாழ விரும்பவில்லை; அவசியமில்லாத விலக்கத்தை ஏற்றுக்கொள்ளவும் விரும்பவில்லை. வாழ்வின் மணமும், சுவையும், ஆழமும் நிறைந்த வாழ்வை வாழ விரும்பினேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's philosophical meaning and intent, though some nuances are lost or altered. The Tamil rendering is somewhat awkward syntactically, with overly complex sentence structures that don't flow naturally, though the poetic and contemplative tone is largely preserved.

results.translated_text:
என்னை இஷ்மாயில் என்று அழைக்கவும். சில ஆண்டுகளுக்கு முன்பு—மிகத் துல்லியமாக எவ்வளவு காலம் என்பது முக்கியமில்லை—என் கையிலோ, கடற்கரையில் என்னை ஈர்க்கும் சிறப்பான ஒன்றும் இல்லாமல், நாணயங்களோ, நிதியோ மிகக் குறைவாக இருந்தன. எனவே, நான் உலகின் நீர் பகுதிகளைச் சுற்றிப் பார்க்கும் வகையில், சிறிது காலம் கடலில் பயணிக்க முடிவு செய்தேன். இது எனக்கு மனக்கலங்கலைத் தீர்க்கவும், இரத்த ஓட்டத்தைச் சீரமைக்கவும் வழக்கமான வழி.

எனது வாயில் கருப்பு நிறம் பூசத் தொடங்கும் போதெல்லாம்; எனது ஆன்மாவில் மழை பெய்யும், குளிர் காற்று வீசும் நவம்பர் மாதம் போலக் கனத்து போகும் போதெல்லாம், நான் கடலுக்குச் செல்ல வேண்டிய நேரம் வந்துவிட்டது என்று கருதுகிறேன். என்னால் முடிந்தவரை விரைவாகக் கடலுக்குச் செல்வேன்.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic narrative content but struggles with accuracy in several phrases (e.g., 'எனது வாயில் கருப்பு நிறம் பூசத்' misinterprets 'growing grim about the mouth'), and fails to preserve Melville's introspective, meditative tone and archaic literary style. The prose reads awkwardly in Tamil with structural choices that feel forced rather than natural.

results.translated_text: Это общеизвестная истина, что человек, обладающий значительным состоянием, непременно должен искать себе жену. Как бы ни были скрыты его чувства и взгляды при первом появлении в новой местности, эта истина так прочно укоренилась в умах окружающих семей, что он сразу же считается законной добычей одной из их дочерей.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Austen's ironic opening with excellent semantic fidelity, capturing the satirical tone through phrases like 'законной добычей' (rightful property/prey). The prose flows naturally in Russian with period-appropriate formality, though 'сразу же' adds slight immediacy not present in the original.

results.translated_text: В студии витал густой аромат роз, а когда лёгкий летний ветерок шелестел среди садовой зелени, через открытую дверь доносился тяжёлый запах сирени или более нежный дух розовоцветной шиповницы. Из угла дивана, обитого персидскими седлами, на котором он лежал, как обычно, куря бесчисленные сигареты, лорд Генри Воттон едва улавливал золотистый блеск мёдово-сладких цветов золотого дождя.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the sensory richness and meaning, though 'обитого персидскими седлами' (upholstered with Persian saddles) is awkward compared to the original's 'Persian saddle-bags,' and some aesthetic nuance is lost. The prose flows reasonably well in Russian but lacks the original's lyrical elegance in places.

results.translated_text:
— Вы были в Афганистане, я так понимаю.
— Как вы догадались? — удивился я.
— Не важно, — усмехнулся он про себя. — Сейчас речь идёт о гемоглобине. Не сомневаюсь, вы понимаете значение моего открытия?
— Химически, конечно, интересно, — ответил я, — но практически…
— Человек, это же самое практичное медико-правовое открытие за последние годы! Не видите, что оно даёт нам безошибочный тест на кровяные пятна?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow, with natural Russian phrasing. Minor deviations include 'про себя' (to himself) being slightly less precise than the original's internal chuckling, and 'Человек' (Man) feeling slightly more colloquial than Holmes's characteristic Victorian formality, but these are minor stylistic choices that work well in Russian.

results.translated_text: Я отправился в лес, потому что хотел жить осознанно, встречаться только с сущностью жизни и понять, что она может мне преподать. Не хотел бы я, когда придет час умирать, обнаружить, что прожил не так, не в полную силу. Не желал я жить лишь тенью существования — жизнь слишком драгоценна, чтобы тратить её на пустые компромиссы. Я стремился жить глубоко, выжимать из жизни каждый сок, до последней капли.

However, some nuances are lost or altered: 'front only the essential facts' becomes 'встречаться только с сущностью' (meet only the essence), which softens the confrontational tone; 'living is so dear' is restructured rather than directly rendered; and 'suck out all the marrow' becomes 'выжимать из жизни каждый сок, до последней капли' (squeeze every drop), which adds intensity but shi

results.translated_text: Зовите меня Ишмаилом. Несколько лет назад — точно не помню, сколько — у меня в кошельке почти не осталось денег, и на берегу не было ничего, что могло бы меня заинтересовать. Тогда я решил немного поплыть и посмотреть на водную часть света. Это мой способ избавиться от хандры и привести в порядок кровообращение. Как только я начинаю хмуриться, как только в моей душе наступает сырая, пасмурная ноябрьская тоска, я считаю, что пришло время как можно скорее отправиться в море.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the meaning well with only minor shifts (e.g., 'driving off the spleen' becomes 'избавиться от хандры' which is slightly more literal), and maintains the archaic tone reasonably. However, some poetic nuance is lost—'watery part of the world' becomes 'водную часть света' which is less evocative, and the rhythm of the original's philosophical meditation is somewhat flattened in places.

results.translated_text: Це загальновідома істина, що чоловік, який володіє значним статком, обов’язково шукатиме собі дружину. Незалежно від того, наскільки невідомі почуття чи погляди такого чоловіка на перший погляд у новому сусідстві, ця істина настільки глибоко вкорінена в свідомості оточуючих родин, що його вважають законною здобиччю однієї з їхніх дочок.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and maintains the ironic tone of Austen's opening, though 'законною здобиччю' (lawful prey/property) is slightly more aggressive than the original 'rightful property,' and the opening lacks the subtle ironic distance of 'It is a truth universally acknowledged.'

results.translated_text: У студії панував багатий аромат троянд, а коли легкий літній вітерець проносився крізь садкові дерева, через відкрите вікно доносився важкий запах сирени або більш ніжний аромат терну з рожевими квітами. З куточка дивана, оббитого перськими сідлами, на якому лежав, як за звичайку, палючи безліч сигарет, лорд Генрі Воттон лише помітив блиск медовосладких і медовокольорових квіток гірчичника.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'вікно' (window) should be 'двері' (door), 'терн' (hawthorn) is incorrect for 'thorn', and 'гірчичник' (mustard plant) is wrong for 'laburnum'. The sensory richness and aesthetic precision of Wilde's prose are diminished, and the phrasing feels awkward in places, particularly 'оббитого перськими сідлами' (upholstered with Persian saddles) which misses the poetic quality of 'Persian saddle-bags'.

results.translated_text:
— Ви були в Афганістані, я зрозумів.
— Як ви дізналися? — здивувався я.
— Не важливо, — посміхнувся він собі. — А тепер мова йде про гемоглобін. Безсумнівно, ви бачите значення цього мого відкриття?
— Хімічно це, безсумнівно, цікаво, — відповів я, — але на практиці…
— Чому ж, людина, це найпрактичніше медико-правове відкриття за останні роки! Не бачите ж ви, що це дає нам безпомилковий тест на кров’яні плями?

scores.feedback: The translation accurately captures the meaning and dialogue flow of the original text, with natural Ukrainian phrasing that reads well. Minor stylistic considerations: 'посміхнувся він собі' is slightly awkward (better as 'посміхнувся собі' or 'посміхнувся'), and 'Чому ж, людина' is a somewhat loose rendering of 'Why, man' that slightly shifts tone, though it remains acceptable for the character's enthusiasm.

results.translated_text: Я пішов у ліс, бо хотів жити свідомо, стикатися лише з суттєвими фактами життя й спробувати зрозуміти, що воно має мені дати. І щоб, коли настане час помирати, не виявилося, що я не жив. Не бажав жити тим, що не є життям — адже саме життя таке цінне; і не хотів практикувати покору, якщо це не абсолютно необхідно. Я бажав жити глибоко й вичавити з життя кожну краплю його соку.

scores.feedback: The translation faithfully preserves Thoreau's meaning and philosophical intent, with strong rendering of key concepts like 'deliberately' (свідомо) and 'essential facts' (суттєвими фактами). Minor deviations include 'краплю його соку' (drop of its juice) being slightly less vivid than 'marrow,' and some slight restructuring of clauses, but these maintain overall fidelity to the original's contemplative, determined tone.

results.translated_text: Звати мене Ішмаїлом. Декілька років тому — не важливо, точно скільки — маючи в кишені майже чи зовсім немає грошей і нічого особливого, що б мене цікавило на суші, я подумав, що відпливлю на невеличкий круїз і побачу водяний світ. Це мій спосіб позбутися сумних думок і налаштувати кровообіг. Коли почуваю, як мої губи стискаються в сувору лінію, коли в моїй душі панують похмурі, дощові листопадові настрої, я вважаю, що настав час якнайшвидше відплисти в море.

scores.feedback: The translation preserves the core meaning and narrative voice well, though some nuances are lost—'driving off the spleen' becomes 'позбутися сумних думок' (rid oneself of sad thoughts), which is less metaphorically precise. The archaic, introspective tone is mostly maintained but occasionally feels slightly more modern in phrasing than the original's deliberate formality.

results.translated_text: إن حقيقةً مَشْهُورَةً مُعْتَبَرَةً على نطاقٍ عالمي، أن رجلاً وحيداً يُمِلِك ثروةً جَيِّدَةً، لا بُدَّ وأنَّهُ يُرِيدُ زوجةً. مهما كان جهلُنا بِشُعُورَاتِهِ أو آرَائِهِ عند دخوله جِوارَ جِيرَانِهِ لأولِ مرَّةٍ، فإنَّ هذه الحقيقة مُسْتَقِرَّةٌ في أذهانِ العائلاتِ المُحيطَةِ به إلى حدٍّ كبيرٍ، فَيُعْتَبَرُ كَمِلْكٍ مُسْتَحِقٍّ لأحدِ بنَاتِهِنَّ أو أُخْرَى.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and ironic premise accurately, but the Arabic phrasing is somewhat awkward and overly formal, losing the elegant simplicity and biting irony of Austen's original voice. The structure feels labored rather than naturally flowing, and key stylistic elements like the understated wit are diminished.

results.translated_text: ملأ الاستوديو رائحة الورد الغنية والثرية، وعندما هبّ نسيم الصيف الخفيف بين أشجار الحديقة، حمل عبر الباب المفتوح رائحة اللبلاب الكثيفة، أو العطر الأرقى للشرشوف الوردي. من ركن الكنبة المبطنة بالجلود الفارسية التي كان مستلقيًا عليها، وهو يدخن كما كان عادته، سيجارًا بعد سيجار بلا عدد، كان اللورد هنري ووتون يستطيع أن يلمح لمعان زهر اللابرنوم الذهبي العسل، الحلو العسل.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the basic meaning but contains significant errors: 'lilac' is mistranslated as 'laburnum' (اللبلاب), 'pink-flowering thorn' becomes 'pink artichoke' (الشرشوف), and the sensory richness is diminished by awkward phrasing and redundancy ('honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes repetitive 'الذهبي العسل، الحلو العسل'). The aesthetic fluidity of Wilde's prose is lost in the translation's stilted construction.

results.translated_text:
قال: "لقد كنت في أفغانستان، هذا ما أفهمه."
فقلت مستنكرًا: "كيف علمت بذلك؟"
فقال وهو يضحك لنفسه: "لا يهم."
والسؤال الآن عن الهيموغلوبين. بلا شك ترى أهمية هذا الاكتشاف الخاص بي؟
قلت: "إنه مثير للاهتمام من الناحية الكيميائية بلا شك، لكن من الناحية العملية..."
فقال: "يا رجل، هذا هو الأكثر عملية من الناحية الطبية والقانونية منذ سنوات. لا ترى أن هذا يوفر لنا اختبارًا لا يخلو من خطأ لبقع الدم؟"

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning but has structural issues: the first line incorrectly attributes 'I perceive' as Holmes's own statement rather than Watson's observation, and dialogue attribution becomes unclear in places. While vocabulary is generally accurate, the Arabic phrasing feels stilted and lacks the natural conversational flow of the original Victorian dialogue.

results.translated_text: ذهبت إلى الغابات لأنني أردت أن أعيش بشكل مقصود، وأواجه فقط الحقائق الأساسية للحياة، وأرى ما إذا كنت أستطيع أن أتعلم ما لديها من دروس، ولا أجد عند وفاتي أنني لم أعش. لم أرغب في العيش بما ليس حياة، فالحياة ثمينة جدًّا؛ ولا أردت أن أتعلم الاستسلام إلا إذا كان ذلك ضرورة. كنت أريد أن أعيش عميقة، وأستخرج كل نكهة الحياة.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning accurately, but several phrases lose nuance: 'أعيش عميقة' (live deep) is grammatically awkward, 'أستخرج كل نكهة' (extract all flavor) weakens the visceral 'suck out all the marrow,' and the philosophical intensity of the original's rhythm and repetition is diminished in the Arabic rendering.

results.translated_text: ادعوني إسماعيل. منذ سنوات قليلة – لا يهم بالضبط كم من الوقت مضى – ولم يكن في جيبي إلا قليل من المال، ولا شيء خاص يجذبني على الشاطئ، ففكرت في أن أبحر قليلا وأرى الجزء المائي من العالم. هذا طريقتي في طرد الحزن وتسيير الدم في عروقي. كلما وجدت نفسي أشيب حول الفم، كلما كان في نفسي نوفمبر رطب وممطر، كنت أحسب أنه الوقت المناسب للرحيل إلى البحر بأسرع ما يمكن.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of the meaning accurately, though 'أشيب' (become white-haired) misses the intended sense of 'growing grim,' and some metaphorical nuances are lost. The prose reads somewhat awkwardly in Arabic, lacking the natural flow and archaic elegance of Melville's original voice.

results.translated_text: אמת מוכחת היא, כי גבר יחיד בעל הון טוב, חייב להיות מחפש אישה. כמה שפחות ידועות עשויות להיות הרגשות והדעות של גבר כזה עם כניסתו לראשונה לשכונה, האמת הזו קבועה כל כך בנפשות המשפחות הסובבות, עד שהוא נחשב כרכושו המיועד של אחת מבנותיהן או אחרת.

scores.feedback: The translation accurately conveys the meaning and captures Austen's ironic tone reasonably well, though the Hebrew phrasing is somewhat more formal and less naturally flowing than the original's elegant simplicity. Minor word choices like 'מחפש' (searching for) versus a more idiomatic expression could enhance the naturalness of the prose.

results.translated_text: החדר היה מלא בריחות העשירים של ורדים, ובשעת שהרוח הקלה של הקיץ נדדה בין עצי הגן, הגיע דרך הדלת הפתוחה ריח הכבד של הלילך או הריח הנעים והעדין יותר של השיח הצרוף הפורח ורוד. מפינה הדיוואן, שעוטר בשקי סדן פרסיים עליהם שכב, כמוהו, מעשן עשן סיגריות בלתי מנויות, יכול לורד הנרי ווטון להבחין בבוהק הפרחים הדביקים והחומים של העץ הלבנה.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most core meanings but loses aesthetic precision in several places: 'honey-sweet and honey-coloured' becomes merely 'sticky and brown,' and 'laburnum' is rendered as 'linden tree' (incorrect botanical reference). The Hebrew phrasing is often awkward and unnatural, with constructions like 'כמוהו, מעשן' that disrupt flow, and the sensory richness of Wilde's aestheticism is diminished through less evocative word choices.

results.translated_text:
"הייתם באפגניסטן, אני חושב," אמר.
"איך בכלל ידעתם זאת?" שאלתי בהלם.
"לא חשוב," אמר, צוחק לעצמו. "השאלה עכשיו היא על ההמוגלובין. ללא ספק רואים את החשיבות של גילויי זה?"
"מרתק כימית, ללא ספק," עניתי, "אבל מבחינה מעשית—"
"מה, אדם, זהו גילוי רפואי-משפטי המעשי ביותר בשנים האחרונות! לא רואים שזה נותן לנו בדיקה בלתי-נכזבת לנקודות דם?"

scores.feedback: The translation captures the essential meaning and dialogue structure well, preserving Holmes's deductive manner and Watson's astonishment. Minor issues include slightly awkward phrasing in places (e.g., 'מרתק כימית' could be more natural) and the opening attribution 'אמר' feels slightly disconnected from the dialogue, but overall it maintains the Victorian detective fiction tone and character dynamics effectively.

results.translated_text: הייתי ליער כי רציתי לחיות באופן מכוון, להתמודד רק עם העובדות המרכזיות של החיים ולראות אם לא אוכל ללמוד מה יש להם ללמד, ולא שבאתי למות ואגלה שאיני חי. לא רציתי לחיות חיים שאינם חיים, כי החיים יקרים כל כך; ולא רציתי להתרגל להתפטרות, אלא אם כן זה היה הכרחי. רציתי לחיות עמוק, לשאוב את כל המוח של החיים.

scores.feedback: The translation captures most of Thoreau's meaning but has notable issues: 'הייתי ליער' (I was to the woods) is awkward; 'להתמודד' (to confront/deal with) misses the contemplative sense of 'front'; and 'לשאוב את כל המוח' (suck out all the brain) is a mistranslation of 'marrow,' losing the poetic metaphor. The philosophical tone is somewhat diminished by these choices.

results.translated_text: קראו לי ישמעאל. לפני שנים אחדות — לא חשוב בדיוק כמה — כשלא היה לי כמעט כסף בכיס ולא היה לי דבר מיוחד שיעניין אותי ביבשה, חשבתי שאסעיף מעט ואשוטט בעולם המימי. זה דרך שלי להילחם בדיכאון ולשפר את זרימת הדם. כל פעם שאני מרגיש את הפה שלי מתעקש, כל פעם שזה נובמבר לח ומעונן בנשמתי, אני חושב שזה הזמן להתנפף לים כמה שיותר מהר.

scores.feedback: The translation captures the core meaning and maintains most narrative elements, but loses some of Melville's philosophical nuance and archaic formality. Several phrases feel awkwardly constructed in Hebrew (e.g., 'מתעקש' for 'grim,' 'להתנפף' for 'get to sea'), and the poetic introspection of the original is somewhat diminished by more literal renderings.
